definitions.definition: a fungus with a round flat head and short stem. Many mushrooms can be eaten.

examples.text: a field mushroom *(= the most common type that is eaten, often just called a ‘mushroom’, and often grown to be sold)*
Slice the mushrooms and add to the salad.
They went into the woods to pick wild mushrooms.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (originally denoting any fungus having a fleshy fruiting body): from Old French mousseron, from late Latin mussirio(n-).
